Posts.Content: abbyglp wrote: Saw onc today and he said my case was getting complicated, and that he was starting to worrry about me. I will try and keep this short and explain what has been happening, I know you all will have some aswers because I know I am not the only one to have this problem. You all are so knowledgeable and I trust you to help me direct my onc in the right direction. He is scaring me as far as trust in him is going. This can not be this difficult to figure out. Well here has been the plan of action he has had me on.... tx 1- was 65mg of taxetere and 50mg of carbo platletts dropped 120 , TM's went to 165 tx2- was 65mg taxetere and 50mg of carbo and platletts dropped more to 59, TM's dropped to 135 skipped chemo for 3 weeks platletts came up to 90 tx 3= 65mg taxetere and 50mg of carbo and zometa and herceptin platletts dropped to 59 tx4- He went ahead with chemo but lowered the doses to 35mg taxetere and 25mg of carbo, weekly herceptin. TM's went back up to 135, platletts came up to 60 tx5- He wanted to drop the taxetere and just do carbo I refused and asked him to keep me on the taxetere and herceptin, TM's went up 145, platlets up to 80 and still amemic (SP) tx6- today and he is confused as to how to handle this, if he increases the mg back up to 65 for the taxetere he is afraid of my platlets bottoming out, but yet the low dose of taxetere he is afraid is not doing anything. He wants to see my TM's going down. and the more he changes like adding or taking away things we are not a decrease in TM's. Why is he so bent on the TM's when some onc's do not do them at all. I told him there are other reasons for them to go up but he insists that they have been accurate in my dx. so he is reading them like a bible, He said we will just see what they are in 21 days and if they go up again we will do another bone scan and see what my platletts are doing. Does anyone have any advice for  me to share with him.  At this point I am not feeling like I will be on any chemo break for a long time. Need help please. Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2009 05:37PM abbyglp wrote: I did the xeloda and tykerb combo, I started with the xeloda first for about 3 months before they added the tykerb. So my experience with the xeloda was easy. I had to stay away from fried greasy foods while I was on it. I found that I felt nauseated after eating them, I did experience hand foot tingling and some diarahea. The diarahea increased alot after they added the tykerb in. But overall the xeloda was easy for me compared to the combo I am on now, taxetere and we stopped the carbo. I see that you are not her2 + so you will not need the tykerb. I do not know what the side effects of ixempra are. They usually start you off with the highest dose of xeloda and lower it to the point of the least SE. I am sure the tiredness is from the morphine, Have you tried to control the pain with anything less like percocet? I did the taxol the first time and I remember how much pain it can cause, Once we stopped the taxol it took about a month for the pain to decrease and about 2 months before I felt alot better. Someone will come along that has had ixempra and xeloda together and give you their thoughts and experiences, I wish the xeloda lasted longer for me It was so easy and no hair loss. hugs

Posts.Content: May 27, 2008 06:03PM abbyglp wrote: Dragonfly, I just have to tell you I love the name. I sit on our dock  with a cane pole and fish and I love it when dragonflys land on my cane pole, I find it relaxing watching the dragonflys and fishing. I forget about cancer for the short time I am out there. I am sorry you have to join us, I myself have just been dx with bone mets to spine. My bone scan came back as abnormal and my onc changed my hormonal from arimidex to aromisin, I had to wait for 3 weeks to get an MRI to confirm, then waited 3 weeks to be sent to rads onc. who then told me he was not convinced that it was bone mets, so then 2 weeks later they sent me for a biopsy, I waited a week for the results, the whole time I waited I prayed all was going to come back as negative but it didn't. The biopsy confirmed it was positive for spine mets. They told me I had to wait 2 weeks to go back to the rad onc to start radiation to my spine. So you no what i did, I bought a plane ticket home and spent the best 2 weeks of my life with my family and did not think about cancer. I came back and had my tumor markers drawn and they dropped 15 points. I just finished my 15th rads to my spine and I have had an infusion of zometa to strengthen my bones, I also have been taking 2 vitamin D3's a day with a calcium pill. I read all the posts from these wonderful caring women on this board and the more you come here the more strength you will draw from them. I have learned so much from reading there posts. Once you get a plan of tx in place you will start feeling better. Hugs abby

Posts.Content: abbyglp wrote: I have been not doing to well these past couple of months but my problems were petty compared to what was happening onthe boards with others. I am now at my witts end and do not no what to do. 4 months ago after having herceptin, zometa and taxtere and carbo all in one sitting. The next day I had such hip pain I could hardly walk. Oncs said well we can go for rads but our rads machine is torn apart right now. Any way with my hip hurting so bad I walked with limp and I could feel it take a toll on my ankle. Well lo and behold my ankle swelled up and became very pain full, I went to my GP and he said it was gout he put me on prednisone, It helped for about a week and the pain was back. I wrapped it and it continued to swell, so my onc gave me gout meds to take and they did nothing for it. So he sent me to an orthopedic doc and he did xrays and said he found no fracture so lets do an MRI. Well My tibia lit up on the MRI and he said that cancer was rarley found below the knee. Lets treat it like a stress fracture and now I wear a power ranger boot. It is still swollen. The thing is I had a bone scan a month ago and they said there was healing and my CT was clean. But my TM's are rising. I have been complaining that my ear and bottom jaw ached and my jaw and lower lip are tingling and numb, So he put me on 3 different antibiotics to try and clear that up and it is not working. I have such hip and leg pain I can hardly walk. I have no answers about what is going on. I have just been on herceptin and taxatere these last 2 tx. I just went this week because I was neutropenic no WBC. So he was afraid I would get another infection on top of what ever else I have going on. I know that infections can cause TM's to rise, but I found a lump under my arm and I was thinking that it was a lymph node, well my onc felt it and said it is definetley cancer. WTF, I have been on chemo for the last 6 months and I am getting worse and not better. non of this is making sence to me. I have an infection in my ear and jaw that we can not clear up and I have pain and swelling in my hip and ankle that they can not figure out what it is, and now a have a swollen lymph node full of cancer. I have to go wed for my next tx, and I am sure my TM's will have risen more. What do I do, ask him to change my tx or tell him just give me a break and see if I start feeling better. I am getting so depressed that I have only been able to work a day or two a week, and I can not get out of the chair once I am home. I am tired of being a couch potato. I try to push myself and all I do is cause more swelling in my ankle and pain in my leg. I am afraid I really do have the rare cancer that is in my tibia. But why would it not bother me until after I started chemo, why was it not this bad before chemo. I am so depressed... and I am losing faith in doctors. I want to just cry. I need any help I can get. please. Dx 5/5/2006, IDC, 5cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 6/15 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

DAH I know that this is why I came here. He said it was very rare for the cancer to spread there, but I guess if I was not a cancer patient he would say it was osteoporsis. Well why can't I get that answer. I went to see another ortho for my back because of the scoliosis and he said well if you did not have cancer we would fix this before it got any worse. I go to GP he tells me you are really a sick person I usually just see patients that need antibiotics for sinus and shoo away the patients that want pain meds. Why do other docs not see anything past the cancer dx. I feel like I am limited to my onc for everything that goes wrong and I do not feel that he is able to tx or see anything beyond cancer. Does anyone run into this with other doctors.?I know my body is telling me it is ready for a chemo break, It has been 6 months and good scans and he wants to continue chemo aand even add another chemo because my TM's keep going up. Hell with the TM's I feel like I am only existing and not able to live. and that is not how I want to be. I am confused and hurting and depressed that he has not given me any hope, I am taking it upon myself to tell him that my body needs a break and I understand the consequenses. I have to no if I can have a better quality of life if I take a break from chemo. It might be a mistake but I have to know if I can have some relief from all this misery even if it is for a short time. living in my room on my bed is not what I can do anymore. there has to be more.Thank you all again. Hugs gale

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2008 09:33PM abbyglp wrote: Hi, I just came back from oncs today and she feels that if she starts me on xeloda now I would probably end up in hospital. I am having bad side effefts from the rads.Bad, Bad, nausea and diareha. taking pepto and just got a script for anti nausea. So my plan of action will be zometa, tykerb and adding xeloda in september, she wants to give my body time to recover completely from rads since it has really only been 5 weeks earlier that i had 15 tx of rads to C-spine, and now having 10tx to pelvic, lumbar spine and right thigh. I asked her if I had progression then does that mean the aromasin is not doing anything, she felt that because I was ER+ 99% at dx. that I still should be on a hormonal, we will be either doing temoxofin, or the one that is a once a month shot, forgot the name. I am opting for the once a month shot one less pill a day would be nice. she told me the xeloda dosage is based on weight and size of person. she said they will start with the max dose for my size and then adjust it from there. At least no hair loss. gma5279 I would ask what your er status was at dx, I did not feel comftorable stopping it even when I found out that my mets are no longer er+. she told me it would not hurt to take it even if it was not curing my bone mets but it could be keeping something that might be lurking at bay. So If you were highly er+ at dx, I would continue taking something . hugs abby

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2007 02:09PM abbyglp wrote: Marrikay, Hi, I just had my check up and my ca27-ca29 was 38. My doctor told me that these markers fluctuate. Small increases at a time is not anything to worry about. I had a sinus and ear infection and my doctor told me that might be why it went up a couple of points. If you have it done and it shoots up 30 to 100 points, than they would do scans to rule out mets. But everyone is different and everyone levels out in different areas of the scale. She told me she has a patient that is cancer free and has leveled out at 63 cause that is what is normal for her. So do not worry. hugs abby
